section.title: Overview
section.para: This module is an implementation of a cache system designed to work with a regular SQL-based server. It uses the internal DB interface to connect to the back-end, and also implements the Key-Value interface exported from the core.

para.emphasis: memory costs are no longer on the server
the cache is 100% persistent. A restart of OpenSIPS server will not affect the DB. The DB is also persistent so it can also be restarted without loss of information.
Multiple OpenSIPS instances can easily share key-value information via a regular SQL-based database
The module's counter operations ( ADD and SUB ) are currently only supported by MySQL

section.title: External Libraries or Applications
section.para: The following libraries or applications must be installed before running &osips; with this module loaded:

section.title: cachedb_url (string)
section.para: The url of the Database that OpenSIPS will connect to in order to use the from script cache_store,cache_fetch, etc operations.
The format to follow is : sql:[conn_id]-dburl
The parameter can be set multiple times to create multiple connections accessible from the OpenSIPS script.

section.title: db_table (string)
section.para: The table of the Database that OpenSIPS will connect to in order to use the from script cache_store,cache_fetch, etc operations.

section.title: key_column (string)
section.para: The column where the key will be stored

section.title: value_column (string)
section.para: The column where the value will be stored

section.title: counter_column (string)
section.para: The column where the counter value will be stored

section.title: expires_column (string)
section.para: The column where the expires will be stored

section.title: cache_clean_period (int)
section.para: The interval in seconds at which the expired keys will be removed from the database. Default value is 60 ( seconds )

section.title: Exported Functions
section.para: The module does not export functions to be used in configuration script.
